issues.description: The template’s private method singFarmSongVerse is declared without the required Animal parameter (the signature is singFarmSongVerse()), but the UML and reference solution define it as singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal). This prevents students from matching the specified design and calling the method correctly.
issues.suggested_fix: Uncomment and include the Animal parameter in the template stub: change the signature to private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) to match the UML and solution.

issues.description: The problem statement’s Part 2 tasks and song template refer to a method named getFeedingSound(), whereas the UML, Part 1 instructions, and reference solution consistently define and test this behavior via the abstract method messageOnFeed(). This discrepancy will confuse students about which method to implement and use.
issues.suggested_fix: In the problem statement, replace all references to getFeedingSound() with messageOnFeed() so that the method name aligns with the UML, template stub expectations, and reference solution.
